Game.Name: ESPN National Hockey Night (USA) (Beta)
Game.plot: Overview:ESPN National Hockey Night is a hockey game for the Super Nintendo, Sega Genesis and Sega CD released towards the end of 1994. It is licensed by the NHL and features all the actual team names. It is also based on the ESPN TV show of the same name that aired between 1992-2004, and features the voice and digitized likeness of host Bill Clement.The game is the first to provide two different angles of the rink. Players can opt for a horizontal perspective that was popular with earlier hockey games or a vertical perspective which had become the norm for the EA Sports NHL series. The game features all 26 teams of the NHL and allows for up to four players (at least for the SNES version) to take part in Exhibition, Tournament and Season modes.Cheat: Extra Game Options Press C,R,B,R,C,R.Cheat: Extra Game Options At the Game Setup screen, press L,R,C,A,B,B.Cheat: Extra Game Options Press A,C,B,U,R,U to play Pong with new options.Cheat: Extra Game Options Press B,C,C,C,U,D to play Pong with the players.
Game.Notes: ESPN National Hockey Night was one of the many hockey games released back in the day. This one featured all the NHL teams for its time, but lacked an official players license. It had four game modes to choose from: Exhibition, Challenge, Playoff, and Season. The game also features both a horizontal and vertical perspective of the ice, battery backup to save progress and also featured the voice of Bill Clement for play-by-play commentary.
